FILE: cm651666v11.0.txt
DYAD: EGYPT-ISRAEL
RIVALRY: RIV1246
DISPUTE(S): MID1793 MID3386 MID3370 MID3372 MID3371 MID3374 MID3373 MID3429 MID200 MID3405 MID3375 MID3420 MID3419 MID3421 MID3430 MID3422 MID3406 MID3431 MID3376 MID3377 MID3378 MID3379 MID3412 MID1035 MID1480 MID3387 MID1046 MID3380 MID1061 MID3381 MID3382 MID3383 MID3384 MID3385 MID3915 

RIVNOTES: 
RIV1246: MID353 removed in because does not appear in the COW dyadic 3.1 data or the Maoz 2.0 dyadic data. 

PS: 19480514-19790326 0.00 19790327-19890603 -9 19890604-20209999 0.5

PS-UPDATE2020:

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220321
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220321

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID1793

TERRMID: MID1793 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1793 from Gibler 2018, in 1947-1948, Israelis and Palestinians disputed who would control the area that is modern-day Israel. The Israelis declared independence and sovereignty over the land in 1948. A coalition of Arab nations (Syria, Iraq, Egypt, Lebanon, and Jordan) attacked Israel that same day because they denied Israel's claim to sovereignty and wanted a Palestine state instead. A war broke out, and Israel emerged victorious in 1949. Coded territorial MID because Iraq disputed Israel's claim to the territory. 

TERRLINK: MID1793 1 -- third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1793 in this dyad, the TERRMID is between Egypt and Israel, but this MID also involves a territorial MID between the other Israel and other Arab states outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID1793 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1793 the dispute between Israel and the Arab nations involved in this dispute (Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Syria, and Lebanon) also included a dispute concerning sovereignty over the waters off the coast of what is current-day Israel. 

ISLMID: MID1793 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1793 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1793 this MID involves fighting between Israelis and Palestinians before a state was created. Thus, the militarized groups were non-state armed groups fighting for control of the state, making them militarized rebels per our coding scheme. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1793 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1793 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1793 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1793 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3386 

TERRMID: MID3386 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3386 from Gibler 2018, in 1949-1950 Israeli and Egyptian forces clashed in the Negev Desert until Egyptian troops returned to Egypt. From cm narrative, the countries were disputing territory, as Egypt denied Israel's right to exist as a country, disputed the UN decision to grant Israel the land from Palestine, and disputed Israel's unilateral expansion of its borders after it was recognized as a state. These issues fueled a rivalry between Egypt and Israel. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID3386 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3386 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3386 Egpyt denied Israel's right to exist and therefore disputed all Israeli borders, including Israel's maritime possessions. 

ISLMID: MID3386 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3386 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3386 there is no indication in cm narrative, Gibler 2018, or news coverage of this MID that this MID involved militarized rebels. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3386 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3386 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3386 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3386 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3370 

TERRMID: MID3370 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3370 from Gibler 2018, in 1950-1951 Egypt was occupying the Gaza strip and was part of an international effort to boycott Israel (involving Syria and Jordan as well). Tensions escalated, and Israel clashed with Jordan. Egypt threatened to use force against Israel if the UN did not intervene. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the tension between Israel and Egypt, which was connected to Egypt denying Israel's right to exist. Egypt disputed all of Israel's borders and was occupying Gaza. 

TERRLINK: MID3370 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3370 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3379 Egypt disputed all of Israel's borders since it denied Israel's right to exist, thereby disputing Israel's maritime boundaries as well. 

ISLMID: MID3370 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3370 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3370 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPLINK: MID3370 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3370 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3372 

TERRMID: MID3372 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3372 from Gibler 2018, in 1951-1952 Israel and Egypt had several cross-border clashes and shows of force. Coded territorial MID because Egypt disputed Israel's right to exist and control the territory of Israel. The tensions connected to that issue were connected to this MID per cm narrative. 

TERRLINK: MID3372 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3372 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3372 Egypt disputed all of Israel's borders, and by extension disputed Israel's maritime boundaries as well. 

ISLMID: MID3372 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3372 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain

COUPMID-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain

COUPLINK: MID3372 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3372 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3371 

TERRMID: MID3371 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3371 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3371 from Gibler 2018, Israel seized a French vessel that was consigned to Egypt and confiscated ammunition. Egypt claimed that the countries were at war at the time, although Israel had not declared war. From cm narrative, the high tensions and repeated clashes between these countries were due to Egypt denying Israel's right to exist, which involved Egypt disputing Israel's borders. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to Egypt disputing Israel's borders. 

TERRLINK: MID3371 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3371 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3371 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3371 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3371 Egypt was disputing all of Israel's borders, including Israel's maritime boundaries.

ISLMID: MID3371 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3371 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3374 

TERRMID: MID3374 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3374 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3374 from Gibler 2018, in 1952-1954 Egypt and Israel had several border clashes and arrested each other's citizens near the border. Coded territorial MID beacuse Egypt disputed Israel's right to exist and disputed all of Israel's borders; per cm narrative, those issues were connected to this MID. 

TERRLINK: MID3374 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3374 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3374 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3374 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3374 Egypt disputed all of Israel's boundaries, including Israel's maritime boundaries. 

ISLMID: MID3374 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3374 1 -- certain

MID3373 

TERRMID: MID3373 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3373 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3373 from Gibler 2018, Egypt pledged to work with Israel to try and resolve the Gaza dispute but went back on the pledge. Israel responded by attacking Egypt in Gaza, and a series of clashes occurred from 1952-1956. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the dispute over Gaza. Per cm narrative, this was also connected to Egypt disputing Israel's right to exist; Egypt dropped this claim during this MID, but it was active at the beginning. 

TERRLINK: MID3373 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3373 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3373 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3373 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3373 at some points during this MID, Egypt disputed Israel's right to exist and hence all of Israel's bounadries, including their maritime boundaries. 

ISLMID: MID3373 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3373 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID3373 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

MID3429 

TERRMID: MID3429 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3429 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3429 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this MID occurs simultaneously with MID3405 and includes the same events: a series of border clashes between Israel and Egypt. The clashes were not connected to any territorial issues (see MID3405). Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped. 

TERRLINK: MID3429 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3429 1 -- certain

MID200 

TERRMID: MID200 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID200 from Gibler 2018, this is the Sinai War and the Suez Crisis. Egypt nationalized the Suez Canal, endangering Israel's trade. Israel and Egypt then clashed in the Sinai, which itself was being disputed. Fighting continued until 1956. This led Israel to give up its claim on Gaza in 1957. Coded terriorial MID because this was connected to the Sinai Peninsula, which was being disputed. 

TERRLINK: MID200 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID200 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID200 this was connected to the Suez Canal. The countries involved in this MID against Egypt did not claim Suez for themselves, but they disputed Egypt's right to nationalize the canal and exercise complete sovereignty over it. Also, this MID involved the Sinai Peninsula, sovereignty over which had maritime boundary implications. Coded maritime MID because this was partly connected to a maritime border dispute. 

ISLMID: MID200 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID200 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID200 from cm narrative, this MID also involved Egypt beginning to sponsor militarized rebel groups (Fedayeen), who attacked Israel from Sinai. 

CIVWARLINK: MID200 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID200 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID200 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3405 

TERRMID: MID3405 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3405 from Gibler 2018, from 1955-1960 Israel had a series of clashes with Egypt, Jordan, and Syria. The clashes began between Israel and Syria. By this time, Egypt had stopped denying its claim that Israel had no right to exist (it had done so since the end of the Sinai conflict in MID200). This was connected to long-standing tensions between Egypt/Syria/Jordan and Israel, but neither Gibler 2018 nor cm narrative nor the numerous New York Times articles that cover these events (NYT 8/16/1954, 1/17/1955, 5/13/1955, 10/16/1955, 3/5/1956, 9/17/1956, 11/28/1956, 9/11/1957, 4/29/1957, 1/29/1958, 7/4/1958, 4/2/1959, 10/23/1959, 1/9/1959, 6/13/1960, 10/26/1960, 2/2/1960) mention that this was connected to any territorial issues. 

TERRLINK: MID3405 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3405 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3405 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3405 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3405 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3405 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3405 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3405 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3375 

TERRMID: MID3375 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3375 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3375 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3375 from Gibler 2018, in 1957 Israel threatened war if Egypt prevented Israeli ships from accessing the Gulf of Aqaba. Threats and clashes followed until 1961. Coded maritime MID because, although Israel was not claiming the waters in the Gulf of Aqaba as their own, they were disputing Egypt's right to prevent Israel from using the waters. 

ISLMID: MID3375 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3375 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3375 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3375 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3375 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3375 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3420 

TERRMID: MID3420 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID3420 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: Coded territorial MID because per cm narrative, this is one of several MIDs that take place in the period between the Sinai Campaign in 1956 and the Six Day War in 1967, and these MIDs are motivated by Egypt disputing/denying Israel's independence. This amounts to a dispute over all of Israel's territory. However, there is no indication in Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016 or news coverage of this MID that this was directly connected to the territorial issue, so this is coded uncertain for this reason as well. See MARITMID-NOTES. 

TERRLINK: MID3420 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3420 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3420 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3420 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3420 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this was originally coded as an Israeli seizure of Syria/Egypt/Jordan ships in 1958, but there is no evidence that this seizure occurred. GML therefore recommend this case be dropped, so coded uncertain. Coded maritime MID because per cm narrative, this is one of several MIDs that take place in the period between the Sinai Campaign in 1956 and the Six Day War in 1967, and these MIDs are motivated by Egypt disputing/denying Israel's independence. This amounts to a dispute over all of Israel's territory, including maritime boundaries. However, there is no indication in Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016 or news coverage of this MID that this was directly connected to the territorial issue, so the MID is coded uncertain for this reason as well. 

ISLMID: MID3420 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3420 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3420 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3420 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3420 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3420 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3420 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3420 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3420 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3420 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3419 

TERRMID: MID3419 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3419 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3419 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3419 from Gibler 2018, Israel claimed the waters in the Sea of Galilee as within their territorial waters, but Egypt and Syria disputed that. Syrian fishermen continued to fish in the waters, often provoking clashes between Israel and Syria. At this time, Syria and Egypt were both members of the United Arab Republic, pulling Egypt into this MID although the clashes were between Israeli and Syrian jets. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a dispute over the sea of Galilee, and Egypt as part of UAR is directly involved. 

ISLMID: MID3419 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3419 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3419 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3419 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3419 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3419 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3421 

TERRMID: MID3421 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3421 coded territorial MID because this was connected to Egypt denying Israel's right to exist and therefore disputing all of Israel's borders. This MID is confined to maritime incidents, but the maritime issue is connected to the larger issue of not recognizing Israel, which is a territorial dispute. See MARITMID-NOTES. 

TERRLINK: MID3421 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3421 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3421 from Gibler 2018, Israel seized an Egyptian ship that entered Israeli waters in 1959. From New York Times 5/25/1959, Israel claimed the ship had entered its 6-mile territorial water limit. Coded not maritime because Egypt at this time disputed the entirety of Israel's borders, and by extension they denied Israel's maritime boundaries. 

ISLMID: MID3421 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3421 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3421 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3421 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3421 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3421 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3430 

TERRMID: MID3430 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3430 from Gibler 2018, Egypt and Israel engaged in air clashes over the disputed Sinai peninsula, and Egypt deployed troops to the disputed border. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed Sinai border. 

TERRLINK: MID3430 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3430 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3430 this MID also involved Egypt threatening to blockade Israel by shutting off access to the Suez Canal, prompting clashes. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to Israel disputing Egypt's right to deny them access to the Suez Canal, an important maritime passage for Israeli trade. 

ISLMID: MID3430 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3430 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3430 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3430 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3430 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3430 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3422 

TERRMID: MID3422 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3422 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3422 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3422 from Gibler 2018, Israel and Egypt clashed after Egypt threatened to ban Israeli ships from entering the Suez Canal (also from Baltimore Sun 7/30/1960). Coded maritime MID because although Israel did not claim sovereignty over the Suez, it disputed Egypt's right to control Israel's passage through the Suez Canal, which was important for ISrael's trade. 

ISLMID: MID3422 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3422 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3422 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3422 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3406 

TERRMID: MID3406 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3406 from Gibler 2018, in 1961 Israel claimed Egypt violated their airspace over the disputed Sinai and downed an Egyptian plane. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the dispute over Sinai. 

TERRLINK: MID3406 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3406 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3406 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID3406 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3431 

TERRMID: MID3431 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3431 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3431 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3431 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3431 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this MID should be merged with MID3419 as both describe the same event. See MID3419: a dispute over the Sea of Galilee led Israel to seize Egyptian ships. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped. 

ISLMID: MID3431 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3431 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3431 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3431 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3431 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3431 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

	

MID3376 

TERRMID: MID3376 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3376 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3376 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, Israel and Egypt accused each other of kidnapping a rocket expert who supposedly was in the process of reaching a deal with the Israeli government. Israel stated it could not refrain from taking action if Egypt continued this type of action, but GML recommend this case be dropped since this does not constitute a threat, so coded uncertain. Coded not territory because this was not connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID3376 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3376 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3376 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3376 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3376 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3376 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3376 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3376 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

	

MID3377 

TERRMID: MID3377 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3377 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3377 from Gibler 2018, Israeli and Egyptian jets clashed over the demilitarized zone over the disputed Sinai Peninsula. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the dispute over Sinai. 

TERRLINK: MID3377 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3377 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3377 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3377 1 -- certain

CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3377 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3377 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3377 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3377 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3377 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3378 

TERRMID: MID3378 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3378 from Gibler 2018, in 1964 Egypt fired on two Israeli planes and downed one. Egypt claimed the planes were on reconnaissance flights, but Israel denied this. Coded territorial MID because per cm narrative, this was connected to the long-running dispute centered on Egypt's denial of Israeli sovereignty. This was one of several MIDs between the Sinai Campaign in 1956 and the Six Day War in 1967 that were motivated by this issue. 

TERRLINK: MID3378 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3378 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3378 this MID involved a dispute between Egypt and Israel over Egypt's denial of Israeli sovereignty over their territory. This also had maritime boundary implications in the territorial waters around Israel. 

ISLMID: MID3378 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3378 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3378 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3378 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3378 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3378 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3379 

TERRMID: MID3379 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3379 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3379 from Gibler 2018, in 1966 Egypt threatened Israel with force should Israel develop nuclear weapons. Coded not territory because this was not connected to the territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID3379 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3379 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MID3412 

TERRMID: MID3412 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3412 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3412 from Gibler 2018, in 1966 Israel clashed with Syrian forces. Egypt became involved by sending planes to Syria, and Jordan became involved by pledging to strengthen their border against Israel. Coded third party link to territorial MID because per 652666 cm narrative, Syria refused to ratify its borders with Israel because they did not recognize Israel, and the tensions over this issue contributed to this MID. 

MARITMID: MID3412 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3412 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3412 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3412 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3412 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3412 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3412 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3230 

TERRMID: MID3230 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3230 from Gibler 2018, in 1956-1959, Israel and Jordan were disputing the Gaza Strip. Jordan accused Israel of ammassing troops on their border and warned of force if the UN did not ensure Israel's withdrawal from Gaza. Egypt is also pulled into this MID because they used Jordanian territory to launch raids into Israel, over the latter's occupation of Sinai Peninsula. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute between Israel and Egypt in the Sinai. 

TERRLINK: MID3230 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3230 from Gibler 2018, this MID also involved Israel occupying the Gaza Strip and Jordan disputing their claim on Gaza. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute between Israel and Jordan. 

MARITMID: MID3230 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3230 coded maritime MID because the dispute over the Sinai Peninsula had maritime boundary implications at the Suez. 

ISLMID: MID3230 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3230 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3230 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3230 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3230 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3230 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1035

TERRMID: MID1035 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1035 from Gibler 2018, this is the 6-day War between Israel and Iraq, Egypt, Syria, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, and Kuwait. In 1967, Israel attacked Egypt, having already attacked Jordan the year before and expecting that other Arab countries would soon attack Israel. Israel handily defeated the Arab states and took control of territory in Sinai, Golan Heights, and elsewhere. Coded territorial MID because this is connected to a dispute over Israel's boundaries in the Sinai at this time, which Israel was occupying. 

TERRLINK: MID1035 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1035 in this dyad, the TERRMID is between Egypt and Israel, but this MID also involves a territorial MID between Syria and Israel in the Golan Heights, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID1035 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1035 coded maritime MID because the dispute over the Sinai Peninsula had maritime boundary implications at the Suez. 

ISLMID: MID1035 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1035 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1035 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1035 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1035 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1035 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1480 

TERRMID: MID1480 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1480 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1480 from Gibler 2018, after the Six Day war, Egypt wanted to regain control of the Sinai Peninsula and maintained a constant military presence over the disputed boundary, which Israel matched. Clashes erupted in 1967-1970 over the Sinai. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed Sinai border. 

TERRLINK: MID1480 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1480 1 -- certain

MID3387

TERRMID-CER: MID3387 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3387 from Gibler 2018, a cease-fire was negotiated in 1970 but it was immediately violated when Egypt began installing weaponry on the Sinai Peninsula. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed border on Sinai.

MID1046

TERRMID: MID1046 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1046 from Gibler 2018, this dispute between Israel and Egypt, Iraq, Syria, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia occurred in 1971-1973. Israel was occupying the Sinai peninsula of Egypt. The Arab countries attacked Israel on Yom Kippur, but Israel was militarily superior. Israel occupied the Golan Heights of Lebanon and claimed it as a strategically valuable piece of territory. The fighting ceased by May 1974. Coded territorial MID because this is connected to a territorial dispute over the Sinai Peninsula, within this dyad. 

TERRLINK: MID1046 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1046 this MID also involved a dispute over the Golan Heights, outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID1046 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1046 coded maritime MID because the dispute over the Sinai Peninsula had maritime boundary implications at the Suez. 

ISLMID: MID1046 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1046 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1046 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1046 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1046 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3380 

TERRMID: MID3380 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3380 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3380 from Gibler 2018, in 1973-1975 Israel and Egypt again clashed over the Sinai, with several ground and air skirmishes. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a disputed over the Sinai Peninsula. 

TERRLINK: MID3380 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3380 1 -- certain

MID1061 

TERRMID: MID1061 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1061 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1061 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1061 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1061 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID1061 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1061 from Gibler 2018, in 1974-1976 Israel raided several Lebanese villages in response to militarized rebels from Lebanon crossing into Israel and massacring civilians. Egypt threatened to use force against Israel if they did not cease their raids in to Lebanon. Coded civil war link because this was connected to militarized rebels in Lebanon, outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID1061 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID1061 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3381 

TERRMID: MID3381 3 -- not territory

TERRMID-NOTES:

TERRLINK-CER: MID3381 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID3381 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3381 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3381 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3381 from Gibler 2018, in 1975 Egypt expected Israel to get involved in Lebanon's civil war, warned Israel against doing so,and threatened to intervene if they did. Coded civil war link because this is connected to the civil war in Lebanon, outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID3381 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3381 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID3381 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3382 

TERRMID: MID3382 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3382 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3382 from Gibler 2018, in 1977 Anwar Saddat was preparing a visit to negotiate peace with Israel. Israel anticipated attacks from Syria or Lebanon and put their forces on alert. Coded not territory because this was not connected to a disputed boundary. Coded uncertain because Gibler 2018 argues that Syria, not Egypt, should be the target in this MID, and Egypt should not be a participant. 

TERRLINK: MID3382 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3382 no indication in cm narrative, Gibler 2018, or news coverage of this MID that this involved the dispute over the Golan Heights (Israel-Syria). 

MARITMID: MID3382 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3382 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3382 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3382 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3382 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3382 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3383 

TERRMID: MID3383 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3383 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3383 from Gibler 2018, Egypt protested that an Israeli plane flew over the disputed Sinai Peninsula, and Israel did not deny this. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed border in the Sinai. 

TERRLINK: MID3383 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3383 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MID3384 

TERRMID: MID3384 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3384 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3384 from Gibler 2018, Israel and Egypt were in the process of finializing an agreement over the Sinai. Israel protested when several Egyptians entered the neutral territory. Egypt apologized, and the tensions did not escalate. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed Sinai. 

TERRLINK: MID3384 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3384 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MID3915 

TERRMID: MID3915 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3915 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3915 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3915 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3915 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3915 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3915 from Gibler 2018, an Israeli fishing vessel entered Egyptian territorial waters and Egypt fired warning shots. Coded not maritime because they were not disputing a maritime boundary. This occurred after the Sinai agreement was reached. 

ISLMID: MID3915 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3915 1 -- certain

TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4526 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4526 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4526 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4526 1 -- civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4526 from Gibler 2018, Israel fired on Egyptian soldiers, mistaking them for Palestinian militants. Israel apologized. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to militarized rebels in Israel. Although there were not actually rebels involved, the presence of rebels targeting Israel led Israel to believe the Egyptian soldiers were rebels.

CIVWARLINK: MID4526 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4526 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4526 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4526 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4531 

TERRMID: MID4531 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4531 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4531 from Gibler 2018 and cm narrative, in 2006 Egyptian soldiers crossed into Israel and engaged Israeli soldiers. It is unclear why the soldiers crossed into Israel. Coded not territory because they were not disputing a border. 

TERRLINK: MID4531 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4531 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4531 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4531 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4531 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4531 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4531 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4531 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4544 

TERRMID: MID4544 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4544 from Gibler 2018, in 2009 Israeli soldiers shot an Egyptian policemen who they said was acting suspiciously. Coded not territory because they were not disputing a border.

TERRLINK: MID4544 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4544 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4544 3 -- not islands

CIVWARMID: MID4544 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4544 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4544 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4544 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4544 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID353

TERRMID: MID353 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID353 from Gibler 2018, this was connected to the Yom Kippur War. In 1973, as fighting was ongoing, the US and USSR (backing Israel and Egypt, respectively) issued threats to the fighting parties, pulling them into this MID. Coded territorial MID because this was the Yom Kippur War, a territorial MID. Egypt was attempting to take back territory in the Sinai. 

TERRLINK: MID353 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID353 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID353 the Yom Kippur War also involved a territorial dispute between Syria and Israel (outside this dyad) in the Golan. 

MARITMID: MID353 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID353 coded maritime MID because the dispute over the Sinai Peninsula had maritime boundary implications at the Suez. 

ISLMID: MID353 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID353 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain

CIVWARLINK: MID353 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID353 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID353 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID353 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID353 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3385

TERRMID: MID3385 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3385 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3385 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this MID is an extension of MID3384. From Gibler 2018, Israel and Egypt were in the process of finalizing an agreement over the Sinai. Israel protested when several Egyptians entered the neutral territory. Egypt apologized, and the tensions did not escalate. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to the disputed Sinai. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped due to temporal overlap with MID3384. 

TERRLINK: MID3385 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3385 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3385 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID3385 3 -- uncertain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3385 coded maritime MID because the dispute over the Sinai Peninsula had maritime boundary implications at the Suez. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped due to temporal overlap with MID3384. 

ISLMID: MID3385 3 -- not islands
